author: deme1744
content:
Hi <@!436721623014572042> , great to hear that. Feel free to also join our discord if you want to discuss something specific regarding the Nim implementation: https://discord.gg/Na5Ah9JS
If you have questions, feel free to ask early on. I'd also suggest to share a (draft) PR early on so we know the direction you are going.
Aside from that, I'll create an issue in nim-eth Github with a description, so that could also be a place to follow up on the technicalities of the implementation.

author: deme1744
content: As Piper mentioned, it is actually about using uTP to stream data from "within" the discv5 protocol. One part here is, obviously, the implementation of the uTP protocol. This can be for the bigger part  stand-alone from discv5 probably. Another part is how to properly integrate this with current discv5 packet and/or message types. There are some different approaches possible here, but I'm not sure if this is supposed to be part of your project?

author: pipermerriam
content: (If anyone wants a standing invite to the call DM me the email address you'd like the invite sent to)

author: samwilsn
content: <@!425615769280315392> did you have any thoughts on https://github.com/carver/trin/pull/33 ?

author: samwilsn
content: Perfect, here's the new discv5: https://github.com/carver/trin/pull/34

author: samwilsn
content: We're back to not allowing ENRs that don't match the actual public IP, btw

author: samwilsn
content: Apparently if a node isn't certain of its public address, it shouldn't send one.
